job_details.Vacaturetitel: Life Science Software Engineer International Flavors & Fragrances
job_details.Functieomschrijving:
Our R&D team develops microbial production strains and engineer enzymes for applications in the areas of food & beverages, home & personal care, animal feed, paper & textile processing, and more. We implement all steps in the process, from business idea and the use of generative AI to sample genetic diversity, to assay design, high-throughput screening, full-scale testing and manufacture at our production plants.

   We are looking for an experienced engineer at the interfaces of software development, lab automation and biology. As part of our team, you will create software that automates everything that can be automated and ensures that generated data is structured and accessible.

   In our team, machine learning staff, molecular biologists, biochemists, and automation hardware engineers work side-by-side. Improvements are deployed with minimal delay, and you can expect to have large impact on the value of our products.

   As Life Science Software Engineer, you will help to create the stack that implements our domain logic, and how it communicates with storage backends as well as instruments, liquid handlers and fermenters. You have freedom to find preferred 3rd party technologies as well as deciding on the components that you prefer us to develop internally.

   The Leiden R&D team is highly skilled and operates with a start-up mentality and a sharp focus on continuous improvement., * Design data models to support experimental protocols and write software that automates the generation of robot instructions as well as analysis and visualization of biological sequence-, and screening-data.
     * Maintain workflows and be pro-active in adjusting and improving them as experimental techniques evolve.
     * Identify and onboard 3rd party services and tools to offload responsibilities and let us focus on differentiating activities.
     * Create software that allows us to seamlessly integrate our Laboratory Information Management System (Benchling) and ML Ops.
     * Document, communicate and teach colleagues best-practices.
job_details.full_text:
Life Science Software Engineer International Flavors & Fragrances

Our R&D team develops microbial production strains and engineer enzymes for applications in the areas of food & beverages, home & personal care, animal feed, paper & textile processing, and more. We implement all steps in the process, from business idea and the use of generative AI to sample genetic diversity, to assay design, high-throughput screening, full-scale testing and manufacture at our production plants.

   We are looking for an experienced engineer at the interfaces of software development, lab automation and biology. As part of our team, you will create software that automates everything that can be automated and ensures that generated data is structured and accessible.

   In our team, machine learning staff, molecular biologists, biochemists, and automation hardware engineers work side-by-side. Improvements are deployed with minimal delay, and you can expect to have large impact on the value of our products.

   As Life Science Software Engineer, you will help to create the stack that implements our domain logic, and how it communicates with storage backends as well as instruments, liquid handlers and fermenters. You have freedom to find preferred 3rd party technologies as well as deciding on the components that you prefer us to develop internally.

   The Leiden R&D team is highly skilled and operates with a start-up mentality and a sharp focus on continuous improvement., * Design data models to support experimental protocols and write software that automates the generation of robot instructions as well as analysis and visualization of biological sequence-, and screening-data.
     * Maintain workflows and be pro-active in adjusting and improving them as experimental techniques evolve.
     * Identify and onboard 3rd party services and tools to offload responsibilities and let us focus on differentiating activities.
     * Create software that allows us to seamlessly integrate our Laboratory Information Management System (Benchling) and ML Ops.
     * Document, communicate and teach colleagues best-practices.

profile_classification.rationale: The job description emphasizes building software for automating lab processes, data structuring, and accessibility, with a strong focus on data models, experimental protocols, and analysis of biological data. While generative AI is mentioned, the core responsibilities revolve around data engineering, software development for lab automation, and integrating with ML Ops, aligning more closely with the 'ML Engineer' profile's emphasis on data-driven systems and productionizing models within a scientific context.

job_tasks.justification: The phrase 'ensures that generated data is structured and accessible' and 'Design data models to support experimental protocols' directly relates to managing and structuring data.
job_tasks.phrase: ensures that generated data is structured and accessible

job_tasks.justification: The phrase 'Design data models to support experimental protocols' indicates the creation of structures for data related to experiments.
job_tasks.phrase: Design data models to support experimental protocols

job_tasks.justification: The phrase 'create software that automates everything that can be automated' and 'create software that allows us to seamlessly integrate our Laboratory Information Management System (Benchling) and ML Ops' points to building software applications and integrations.
job_tasks.phrase: create software that automates everything that can be automated

job_tasks.justification: The phrase 'create software that allows us to seamlessly integrate our Laboratory Information Management System (Benchling) and ML Ops' describes the development of software for system integration.
job_tasks.phrase: create software that allows us to seamlessly integrate our Laboratory Information Management System (Benchling) and ML Ops

job_tasks.justification: The phrase 'write software that automates the generation of robot instructions' clearly falls under software development for automation.
job_tasks.phrase: write software that automates the generation of robot instructions

job_tasks.justification: The phrase 'write software that automates... analysis and visualization of biological sequence-, and screening-data' describes software development for data processing and presentation.
job_tasks.phrase: write software that automates... analysis and visualization of biological sequence-, and screening-data

job_tasks.justification: The phrase 'Integrate... ML Ops' directly mentions MLOps, indicating a need for operational aspects of machine learning systems.

The mention of 'business idea' and 'applications in the areas of food & beverages, home & personal care, animal feed, paper & textile processing, and more' shows an understanding of the business context and applications.
The phrase 'use of generative AI' indicates involvement with generative modeling techniques.
The phrase 'machine learning staff' implies the use and development of machine learning models.
The phrase 'Maintain workflows and be pro-active in adjusting and improving them' relates to the ongoing management and optimization of operational processes.
job_tasks.phrase: Maintain workflows and be pro-active in adjusting and improving them

job_tasks.justification: The phrase 'Identify and onboard 3rd party services and tools to offload responsibilities and let us focus on differentiating activities' shows an understanding of strategic alignment and business focus.
job_tasks.phrase: Identify and onboard 3rd party services and tools to offload responsibilities and let us focus on differentiating activities

job_tasks.justification: The phrase 'Document, communicate and teach colleagues best-practices' directly relates to communication and knowledge sharing.
job_tasks.phrase: Document, communicate and teach colleagues best-practices
